Paragraph: 1 shows the optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT , PDTP - DTBT and PDTP-DT2BT in CHCl 3 solution and in thin films spin - coated on quartz plates.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |

| optical absorption spectra |
| PDTP-BT |
| PDTP-DTBT |
| PDTP-DT2BT |
| CHCl3 solution |

| spin-coated |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical absorption spectra of PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, and PDTP-DT2BT |
| PDTP-BT in CHCl3 solution |
| PDTP-DTBT in CHCl3 solution |
| PDTP-DT2BT in CHCl3 solution |
| thin films of PDTP-BT, PDTP-DTBT, and PDTP-DT2BT spin-coated on quartz plates |

The entities "optical absorption spectra", "PDTP-BT", "PDTP-DTBT", "PDTP-DT2BT", and "thin films" can be considered material properties as they describe the behavior or characteristics of the materials under investigation. The entities "CHCl3 solution" and "quartz plates" can also be considered material properties as they describe the medium and substrate used in the study, respectively.
